body_html:
Currently, the go libraries are structured to be friendly to the common use of the go toolchain (i.e., the common use with go get).

Could you elaborate a bit on the feature requested here? Is it that you have a project that uses bazel as the build system and want to build all of tensorflow (including the go libraries) from source after adding tensorflow as an external dependency to the WORKSPACE of your project? If so, it's unlikely that anyone on the TensorFlow team will get to making that work in the near future. Or is it something else?

body:
Currently, the go libraries are structured to be friendly to the common use of the go toolchain (i.e., the common use with `go get`). 

Could you elaborate a bit on the feature requested here? Is it that you have a project that uses `bazel` as the build system and want to build all of tensorflow (including the go libraries) from source after adding tensorflow as an external dependency to the `WORKSPACE` of your project? If so, it's unlikely that anyone on the TensorFlow team will get to making that work in the near future. Or is it something else?
